revised_title: Impulse Corona and Long Spark: A Theoretical Analysis
tldr: The article presents an approximate theory of positive impulse corona propagation, based on a model where electrons are produced by photo-ionization and multiplied by electron impact ionization near the corona filament. The author derives formulae to predict speeds of propagation, electron and filament densities, and compares the theory with experimental results, showing reasonable agreement. The theory is then extended to impulse corona and subsequent stages of breakdown.
